posts.author: TheSquid
posts.content:
I looked into when one deals more (expected) damage shooting with a bow/sling with Rapid Shot active or not active.
There is a table by WhiZard about this, but I took a slightly different angle.

Rapid Shot GOOD means that you deal more damage over one round, on average, by turning it on. Rapid Shot BAD means that shooting with it on will result in less expected damage (you will have one more attack but all your attacks will have a higher chance of missing).

Case 0. Your enemy's AC is at least 20 more than your AB. In other words, all your attacks hit only on 20. Verdict: Rapid Shot GOOD. D'uh, one more attack with no penalty whatsoever is better than none. Still not an ideal situation to find yourself in.

Case 1.  Your AB is at least as high as your enemy's AC. In other words, your best attack hits on any roll except 1, and your second-best attack hits on 5. Verdict: Rapid Shot GOOD. You should always have it on, regardless of who you are and if you are hasted or not.

Case 2. You naturally have 4 APR and are not hasted. In other words, Rapid Shot gives you your only extra attack, and you move from four to five attacks per round. Verdict: Rapid Shot GOOD. The only case when you should in theory turn it off is if your enemy's AC is exactly 18 more than your AB. If you manage to determine that that is indeed the case, well done, you have scored a marginal advantage by turning RS off.

Case 3. You naturally have 4 APR and have Haste. Verdict: Rapid Shot BAD. You should have it on if your enemy's AC is at most 5 more than your AB. If it's higher, turn it off.

Case 4. You naturally have 3 APR and have either Haste or Divine Power. In other words, you already have a free attack, and RS gives you a second one. Verdict: Rapid Shot BAD. In this case you should also leave it on only if your enemy's AC is 5 more than your AB or lower.

Case 5. You naturally have 3 APR and have both Haste and Divine Power. In other words, RS gives you a third free attack. Verdict: Rapid Shot BAD. You should never have it on, unless you are in the extreme Case 0 or in the very favorable Case 1.

My conclusions: 
  • Rapid Shot is worth getting as a warrior in an environment where (perma-) Haste is rare, OR as a very high AB character (that is, you expect enemy AC to actually be lower than your AB)
  • Rapid Shot is mostly not worth getting as a Cleric, unless you are an Arcane Archer and have therefore insane AB
I think my numbers are correct, but my analysis could be entirely off of course. I should mention that I have not included critical hits in my computations, but WhiZard claims that they don't change much, and if you do include them then enemy DR also starts mattering and it's a mess.
